item.title: Loblaw 季度业绩超出预期，得益于杂货和药房需求
item.description: 加拿大零售商 Loblaw 周三公布的第一季度收入和利润超出了分析师的预期，这主要得益于其药店和日常必需品折扣店 Maxi 和 No Frills 的强劲需求。【原文：Canadian retailer Loblaw exceeded analysts' expectations for first-quarter revenue and profit on Wednesday, driven by robust demand at its pharmacy stores and discount banners, Maxi and No Frills, for everyday essentials.】

item.title: 早间竞标即使在关税之前，美国经济也在吱吱作响
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 因塔可钟需求坚挺，肯德基母公司百胜餐饮集团销售额超出预期
item.description: 百胜餐饮集团（Yum Brands）周三公布的第一季度可比销售额超出华尔街预期，主要得益于美国塔可钟（Taco Bell）分店和国际市场肯德基分店的强劲需求。【原文：Yum Brands beat Wall Street estimates for first-quarter comparable sales on Wednesday, helped by robust demand at its Taco Bell locations in the U.S. and KFC outlets in international markets.】

item.title: 台湾日月光评估如何支持英伟达 5000 亿美元的美国计划
item.description: 台湾日月光科技股份有限公司（ASE Technology Holding Co.【原文：Taiwan's ASE Technology Holding Co. has yet to decide how it will support a plan by Nvidia to build artificial intelligence servers worth as much as $500 billion in the U.S. over the next four years, it said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 挪威邮轮公司季度盈利不及预期
item.description: 挪威邮轮公司（Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings）周三公布的第一季度营收和利润均未达到预期，原因是对关税不确定性的担忧不断升温，对该邮轮运营商的高端海上航程的需求造成了压力。【原文：Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings missed first-quarter revenue and profit estimates on Wednesday, as rising concerns about tariff uncertainty have pressured demand for the cruise operator's premium sea voyages.】

item.title: 超微因预期下调而下滑，分析师淡化对更广泛人工智能需求的担忧
item.description: 超级微电脑（Super Micro Computer）股价在周三收盘前暴跌 15%，原因是这家服务器制造商下调了收入预期，这是这家昔日的人工智能宠儿在逾期提交文件和卖空者攻击之后试图重拾投资者信心所遭受的最新打击。【原文：Super Micro Computer shares tumbled 15% before the bell on Wednesday after the server maker slashed its revenue forecast, the latest blow to the former AI darling trying to regain investor confidence following late filings and short-seller attacks.】

item.title: 卡特彼勒因需求疲软利润下降，警告关税将冲击全年销售额
item.description: 卡特彼勒周三公布，受经济不确定性导致建筑设备需求疲软的影响，第一季度利润下降。【原文：Caterpillar on Wednesday posted a drop in first-quarter profit, hurt by weak demand for its construction equipment due to economic uncertainty and said annual sales would be slightly lower from a year ago if it accounts for tariff impact.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 CSL 公司评估中国对其美国产药品的关税豁免政策
item.description: 澳大利亚 CSL 有限公司表示，该公司正在评估其用于外科手术的药物是否可以免于中国对美国制造的商品征收 125% 的关税，以尽量减少北京和华盛顿之间贸易战的影响。【原文：Australia's CSL Ltd said it's evaluating whether its drugs used in surgery would be exempted from 125% tariffs China imposed on U.S.-made goods, as it seeks to minimise impact of a trade war between Beijing and Washington.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，阿达尼暂停与以色列塔塔公司就 100 亿美元印度芯片业务的谈判
item.description: 印度亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）的集团已暂停与以色列塔牌半导体公司（Tower Semiconductor）就价值 100 亿美元的芯片项目进行讨论，因为这对该集团没有战略和商业意义，两位熟悉此事的人士告诉路透社记者。【原文：Indian billionaire Gautam Adani's group has paused discussions with Israel's Tower Semiconductor for a $10 billion chip project as it did not make strategic and commercial sense for the group, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 美股期货在数据风暴和巨头财报前不温不火
item.description: 周三，美国股指期货持平或小幅下跌，投资者正准备迎接一系列经济数据和企业业绩，为金融市场动荡的一个月画上句号。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were flat to slightly lower on Wednesday as investors braced for a spate of economic data and corporate results to close a turbulent month for financial markets.】

item.title: 美国众议院小组将权衡削减对消费者和审计的监督
item.description: 美国国会一个小组将于周三审议一项立法，该立法希望大幅削减政府在监管消费金融市场和审查上市公司会计方面的现有努力。【原文：A U.S. congressional panel is set to consider legislation Wednesday that looks to drastically curtail existing government efforts to police consumer financial markets and scrutinize public company accounting.】

item.title: 被玷污的 "华丽 7 "股票反弹面临盈利考验
item.description: 被称为 "壮丽七雄 "的美国科技股和成长股在经历了急剧下滑后，已在某种程度上重新站稳了脚跟，但几周来估值的不断上升和盈利优势的减弱，可能会使它们更难推动华尔街走高。【原文：The U.S. technology and growth stocks known as the "Magnificent Seven" have regained their footing somewhat after a steep slide, but a few weeks of growing valuations and a dimming earnings edge could make it harder for them to push Wall Street higher.】

item.title: 谷歌首席执行官桑达尔-皮查伊将在搜索反垄断审判中出庭作证
item.description: 谷歌首席执行官桑达尔-皮查伊（Sundar Pichai）预计将于周三上午在华盛顿的一次庭审中出庭作证，反垄断执法人员将寻求一项命令，迫使谷歌出售其 Chrome 浏览器，并采取其他措施促进在线搜索提供商之间的竞争。【原文：Google CEO Sundar Pichai is expected to take the stand on Wednesday morning at a trial in Washington where antitrust enforcers seek an order forcing the company to sell its Chrome web browser and take other measures to boost competition among online search providers.】

item.title: 除非美元进一步下滑，否则外国对美国资产的需求将减弱：高盛集团
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）首席经济学家表示，除非美元进一步贬值，否则外国投资者对美元资产的兴趣可能会减弱。【原文：Foreign investor appetite for U.S. dollar assets may wane unless the currency depreciates further, said Goldman Sachs' chief economist, cautioning that a downward trajectory is expected even in the absence of a meaningful economic slowdown.】

item.title: 特朗普上任后的头 100 天，美国的能源主导计划受到贸易不确定性的影响
item.description: 油价已下跌超过 20%，低于许多美国生产商的盈亏平衡成本。【原文：Oil prices have slumped over 20% to below many U.S. producers' breakeven costs.】

item.title: 对冲基金流动 高盛集团称，对冲基金欧洲股票抛售在 3 月和 4 月达到十年峰值
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）的一份报告称，对冲基金在 3 月和 4 月期间抛售了欧洲股票，创下了 10 年来最大的抛售量。【原文：Hedge funds sold European stock during March and April in the largest amount in 10 years, said a report by Goldman Sachs.】

item.title: 巴西桑坦德银行第一季度净利润增长 27.8
item.description: 桑坦德银行（Santander Brasil）周三公布第一季度净利润为 38.6 亿雷亚尔（约合 6.8683 亿美元），同比增长 27.8%，略高于市场预期。【原文：Lender Santander Brasil on Wednesday reported a first-quarter net profit of 3.86 billion reais ($686.83 million), a 27.8% rise from a year earlier, slightly ahead of market expectations.】

item.title: 台湾央行会议纪要显示，美国关税意味着利率决策需谨慎
item.description: 台湾中央银行周三公布的最新会议纪要显示，美国进口关税带来的不确定性意味着利率政策决策需要谨慎。【原文：Uncertainty brought about by U.S. import tariffs means decisions on interest rate policy need to be cautious, according to minutes from the Taiwan central bank's latest meeting published on Wednesday.】

item.title: 贸易战雪上加霜，中国太阳能产业持续亏损
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）发动的贸易战对中国太阳能行业的需求造成了进一步的压力，本周中国太阳能制造商报告了亏损。【原文：China's solar manufacturers reported losses this week as U.S. President Donald Trump's trade war put further pressure on demand in an industry where top manufacturers were already facing low prices and tariffs on exports to the United States.】

item.title: 欧元区经济增长快于预期，贸易战带来巨大冲击
item.description: 周三的数据显示，欧元区第一季度经济增长快于预期，在与美国的贸易战、货币飙升和商业景气恶化削弱欧元区经济之前，欧元区经济在2025年伊始略显乐观。【原文：The euro zone economy grew faster than expected in the first quarter, starting 2025 on a modestly upbeat note before a trade war with the U.S., a surging currency and deteriorating business sentiment weaken it, data showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 微软总裁在美国批评声中表示公司尊重欧洲法律
item.description: 微软总裁布拉德-史密斯（Brad Smith）周三表示，微软尊重欧洲法律，包括旨在控制大科技公司权力的里程碑式立法，这使该公司与白宫产生了矛盾，后者批评了与欧盟规则有关的制裁。【原文：Microsoft respects European laws including landmark legislation seeking to rein in the power of Big Tech, its President Brad Smith said on Wednesday, putting the company at odds with the White House, which has criticised sanctions related to EU rules.】

item.title: 鉴于关税不确定性，芯片设计商联发科无法给出全年业绩展望
item.description: 台湾顶级芯片设计公司联发科技（MediaTek）首席执行官周三表示，由于美国关税的不确定性，他无法给出全年盈利指导，但鉴于人工智能需求强劲，他总体上持乐观态度。【原文：The chief executive of Taiwan's top chip design company MediaTek said on Wednesday he was unable to give full-year earnings guidance due to uncertainty about U.S. tariffs, but that he was generally optimistic given strong AI demand.】

item.title: 贸易不确定性导致荷兰支付公司阿代恩第一季度销售额不及预期
item.description: 全球最大的支付公司之一阿代恩公司周三公布的季度收入低于市场预期，表明这家荷兰公司也未能幸免全球贸易紧张局势对经济活动及其客户的影响。【原文：Adyen , one of the world's largest payment companies, reported quarterly revenue below market expectations on Wednesday, showing the Dutch company was not immune to the impact of global trade tensions on economic activity and its clients.】

item.title: 出口大增，台湾第一季度 GDP 初值创一年来最快增速
item.description: 与 2024 年最后一个季度相比，2025 年第一季度台湾依赖贸易的经济增长速度达到一年来最快，这主要得益于在美国可能征收进口关税之前，科技需求强劲导致出口激增。【原文：Taiwan's trade-reliant economy grew at its fastest pace in a year in the first quarter of 2025 compared with the final quarter of 2024 thanks to an export surge on strong tech demand ahead of the introduction of possible U.S. import tariffs.】

item.title: 微软公司布拉德-史密斯在美国批评声中表示公司尊重欧洲法律
item.description: 微软总裁布拉德-史密斯（Brad Smith）周三表示，微软尊重欧洲法律，包括旨在控制大科技公司权力的里程碑式立法，这使该公司与白宫产生了矛盾，后者批评了与欧盟规则有关的制裁措施。【原文：Microsoft respects European laws including landmark legislation which seeks to rein in the power of Big Tech, its President Brad Smith said on Wednesday, putting the company at odds with the White House which has criticised sanctions related to EU rules.】

item.title: 德国第一季度经济增长 0.2
item.description: 德国统计局周三发布的初步数据显示，2025 年第一季度德国国内生产总值与预期一致，与前三个月相比增长了 0.2%。【原文：Germany's gross domestic product rose in line with forecasts, by 0.2%, in the first quarter of 2025 compared with the previous three-month period, preliminary data from the statistics office showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 莱茵金属公司与洛克希德马丁公司扩大合作
item.description: 德国莱茵金属公司（Rheinmetall）和美国洛克希德-马丁公司（Lockheed Martin）周三在一份联合声明中表示，双方同意扩大合作，并延长于2024年签署的谅解备忘录的有效期。【原文：Germany's Rheinmetall and U.S. firm Lockheed Martin have agreed to expand their cooperation and extended a memorandum of understanding signed in 2024, they said in a joint statement on Wednesday.】

item.title: 漫威电影《雷霆战警*》在贸易战肆虐之际考验中国人对好莱坞的胃口
item.description: 迪斯尼新片《雷霆战警》（Thunderbolts*）将于本周三在中国各地影院上映，成为新一轮贸易战爆发以来第一部在中国上映的美国电影，这将考验中国人对好莱坞大片的胃口。【原文：New Disney movie Thunderbolts* is poised to test Chinese appetite for Hollywood blockbusters as it opens in cinemas around China on Wednesday, making it the first American film to hit movie theatres in the country since a new trade war began.】

item.title: 日本乐天公司高层表示将在印度投资至少 1 亿美元并增加招聘人数
item.description: 日本乐天公司（Rakuten）的一位高层管理人员告诉路透社，该公司的目标是今年在印度投资至少 1 亿美元，并将员工人数增加 8%，以加强其全球业务。【原文：Japan's Rakuten aims to invest at least $100 million and increase its headcount by 8% in India this year to strengthen its global operations, a top executive of the internet conglomerate told Reuters.】

item.title: Aixtron 第一季度订单高于去年同期，称美国关税目前微不足道
item.description: 德国芯片系统制造商爱思强（Aixtron）周三报告称，该公司季度订单量增长了10%，并坚持其全年业绩指引，称与美国关税政策相关的风险 "目前对该行业来说微不足道"。【原文：German chip systems manufacturer Aixtron on Wednesday reported a 10% increase in quarterly orders and stood by its full-year guidance, saying the risks associated with U.S. tariffs policy were "currently insignificant for the sector".】
